comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_Bernhardt This was not her only chateau. She had a summer place in Belle-Ile-en-Mer, an island off the western Brittany coast. Two Youtube videos (in French) show it as a museum: www.youtube.com/watch?v=dpAuuDbwyTw www.youtube.com/watch?v=L6j-RWa4WHM and there are postcards for sale on eBay, etc., e.g., phone-cards.delcampe.net/page/item/id,0179928164,language...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: This photo is depicted in the St. Tammany farmer., July 14, 1917, Section Two, Image 5 and, with the same text, in the Tombstone epitaph., June 10, 1917, WEEKLY EDITION, Image 3, but besides of that I couldn't find anything about this chateau.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @B-59:  Good find.  This shows what I rather suspected.  She had been away from it either because of her leg amputation and recovery and/or German occupation.
